name: Thai Shrimp and Clam Curry
author: Susan Forbes Marden
summary: This sweet-hot Thai recipe can be made with shrimp or chicken and cooks up in minutes. Increase chile sauce and ginger for spicier flavor. Serve in shallow bowls over steamed brown rice.
ingredients: 1 large onion, halved and sliced lengthwise
1 large red bell pepper, seeded and sliced lengthwise
1 teaspoon red chile paste, or more to taste
¼ cup chicken broth, or more as needed  (Optional)
3 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, divided, or more to taste
directions: Heat peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat
Add onion and red bell pepper; saute until softened, about 4 minutes
Add ginger and garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Stir in red chile paste and coconut milk
Add the clams and simmer until flavors combine, 3 to 5 minutes
If curry appears too thick, stir in chicken broth
Finely grate zest from the lime
Stir half of the zest into the curry along with fish sauce and brown sugar
Squeeze some lime juice into the curry
Stir in half of the basil and shrimp; simmer curry until shrimp are opaque and cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes
Thin the curry with more chicken broth if needed
Scoop clams out of the curry, draining their juice back into the saucepan, and discard
Mix in remaining lime zest and basil before serving
